scenarioDescription:
The K2-150 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-150 is a star with 0.46 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.44 times its radius. It is located 334.25 light years away from the solar system.

K2-150 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-150 system


K2-150 b

K2-150 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-150 b is 4.675 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-150 b is 2.000 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.2, and a semi-major axis of 0.0727 astronomical units, K2-150 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-150, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-150 - System With 1 Exoplanet
